WorkItem.Description: I have a Windows 10 PC. I have a feeling that the calculator emulator does not work on Windows 10. I think that I did everything else right. Any help/suggestions?

Comments.Message: I have the same problems on my macOS Sierra. :(
I wish they could fix it.
I fixed it somehow.  I think what fixed it was that I clicked "View" and unchecked "Enable Skin." What matters is that it works now.

I am using Windows 10.  When I use wabbitemu to calculate the mean and standard deviation for a probability distribution and use 1-Var Stats, List, I enter L1, then try to enter a comma, then L2, but the software doesn't let me enter the comma.  Thus I can't enter L1, L2.
I watched a YouTube video and these were the instructions for calculating the mean and standard deviation for a probability distribution.
Same problem - mouse offsets are totally off.
